page.title: 17THE"BRICKY" HUT
page.content:
The concrete building, locally known as the "bricky hut", is situated at the N.W. extremity of the plain of Fidge. It is a relic of{World War 2, and was built to house controls of the lights which were placed on Fidge to create a mock airfield, which was a decoy for the real airfields on the Orkney{Mainland.}The lights were turned on when enemy aircraft were flying over Orkney. If they bombed the decoy, the men on watch set off an explosion so the enemy went away happy, thinking they had damaged an airfield. If a{British aircraft}tried to land, a flare was sent up to indicate to the pilot that he was over a decoy airfield.
The men who kept watch were members of{The Sanday Platoon, Orkney Home {Guard. }
